content:
Ctrl-Enter or Ctrl-Return will send it.

To get your button back try right-clicking where it should be and then choose Customise... That will bring up a screen showing all the buttons you can have and you can drag out the ones you want and drag away those you don't.

content: Are you talking of messages in your trash/junk folder that are not flagged as junk. That is generally mail your provider considers junk places in the relevant folder but Thunderbird does not see it as junk.

content: Thanks Matt. But this did not solve my problem. Here are the steps I followed: 1. Last night: closed all my applications (including Thunderbird) then shutdown my computer. 2. This morning: Powered up my computer; the startup process automatically opens Thunderbird. 3. I checked this email folder again. There were two of these folders again (same name), and both were empty. 4. I closed Thunderbird and deleted file "C:\Users\Sam\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\ardwce2w.default-esr\folderTree.json", then restarted Thunderbird. 5. The problem folder was still there (two instances) and both were empty. 6. File folderTree.json had been recreated, but a bit smaller than before. 7. I repeated step 4, but there was no change in the results. In fact, I repeated it a couple times, with no change in the results.
creator: pi.bike.oracle

content:
Connections to Hotmail should be managed using oauth, not a password. You can delete the oauth token for the account in the password manager to force a full reauthentication, or wait until Microsoft decides the existing authorization requires renewal and do it then.

You might want to check your SMTP settings to ensure he server name is smtp.office365.com and the authentication method is oauth. It sounds like it may not be so, ass there is a password in the password manager for SMTP
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
just clearing the password (there were 2 outlook ones, and an office 360 one) in the password manager worked. No new password to enter, weirdly. Thanks.

Frankly, Thunderbird ergonomics and documentation feel... by nerds for nerds. I can't put that on my family's PCs since I can't get it to work for myself.
creator: oonlan

content:
Windows ha cambiato molte volte il programma pre-installato per la posta elettronica. Dipende da quale hai usato.

Andando in Tasto menu > Strumenti > Importa trovi lo strumento di importazione che però supporta psolo Outlook tra i client Microsoft

Se riesci ad identificare con precisione quale programma hai usato e in che formato ha salvato la posta, si possono cercare altre soluzioni.
creator: @next

content: Grazie per la risposta, il programma di posta è Windows Mail su Windows 10 Pro Sistema operativo a 64 bit, processore basato su x64 Posta con estensione .eml che sto vedendo che è la stessa estensione di Outlook grazie
creator: musicdentro

content: Se sono file .eml ti basta trascinarli in una cartella di Thunderbird a gruppi di un centinaio alla volta.

content: Talk to your email provider about password reset options. Note, there is no such thing as a Thunderbird email account. Thunderbird is an application run on your device, so it does not provide email addresses, nor the service to transmit emails. But Thunderbird can be used with your existing email address and service provider to send, receive, sort and search your email messages.

Then I use Firefox to log into gmail and see if there is any mail in the inbox. The solution of deleting the oauth passwords and reauthorize via google seems to work for a while. Currently using version 115.15.0. Nothing appears to stall and mail is received from other email accounts, just google sometimes quits working.

creator: nunziolegra

content: The addressbook name is abook.sqlite . If you know its location, you can import it with tools>import>import a file and proceed to addressbook and sqlite file. if the old PC is still working, you can start thunderbird on it, click help>troubleshooting information, scroll down to 'profile folder', click 'open folder' and you will be in windows file explorer (assuming you use windows) and the abook.sqlite addresssbook will be there, the addressbook for collected addresses is history.sqlite.
creator: davidsk

content: That is the Vertical View. The message list will become easier to read if you highlight the vertical line separating it from the folder list and dragging to the left to make the mane wider . Do you prefer a different layout than vertical? To do that, click the menu bar and then View and Layout and then Wide or Classic. If I am misunderstanding, please let me know. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Before you switch back, check the message list options at settings>general as you have ability to make changes. Also, if the row is too long, could that be a Windows setting? I do not encourage reverting to a prior release unless there is a serious bug that prevents you from accessing your mail.
creator: davidsk

content:
can you post a screenshot of your profile's account folder? you can get there by

  1. help?troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profile folder' in left side
  3. click 'open folder
  4. if IMAP, click the Imapmap folder and then the account folder and do screenprint
  5. if POP, select the Mail folder and then the account folder and do screenshot
creator: davidsk

content: This is usually a network problem and may change from day to day. Sometimes closing and restarting Thunderbird helps, or shutting PC down and restarting When check mail, Thunderbird does nothing except sit and wait for a response from the mail server.
creator: davidsk

content: A simple way, assuming Table View, is to add the 'junk' option to the menu and then click it.
creator: davidsk
